item.title: Nan add a quote by Thomas Merton
item.description: "Merely to resist evil with evil by hating those who hate us and seeking to destroy them, is actually no resistance at all. It is active and purposeful collaboration in evil that brings the Christian into direct and intimate contact with the same source of evil and hatred which inspires the acts of his enemy. It leads in practice to a denial of Christ and to the service of hatred rather than love." -- Thomas Merton

item.title: Nan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Run mad as often as you choose, but do not faint!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nan add a quote by Oswald Chambers
item.description: "It is inbred in us that we have to do exceptional things for God: but we have not. We have to be exceptional in the ordinary things, to be holy in mean streets, among mean people, and this is not learned in five minutes" -- Oswald Chambers

item.title: Nan add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen
